definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)

sentences.english: May the colorful kaleidoscopes arouse memories of your childhood?
sentences.chinese: 五彩斑斕的萬花筒是否能喚起你童年的回憶呢？

sentences.english: Because the kaleidoscope had settled into what appeared to be a pleasing pattern.
sentences.chinese: 原因是萬花筒出現了看似悅目的圖案。

sentences.english: Distinctive originality which is always reflected in the polytropic shopping space brings fashionistas life kaleidoscope.
sentences.chinese: 獨特創意的百變空間，開啓時尚達人生活萬花筒。

sentences.english: Thoughts appear as kaleidoscopic patterns of light and sound.
sentences.chinese: 思想顯現爲光和聲的萬花筒般的圖案。

sentences.english: It will be an adventure of musical kaleidoscopes not to be missed.
sentences.chinese: 這將是一個冒險的音樂萬花筒不容錯過。

sentences.english: Perhaps I am lost in love , I have kaleidoscopic wings .
sentences.chinese: 也許我失去了愛情，還有我萬花筒般的翅膀。
生活猶如萬花筒，五彩繽紛。

sentences.english: Kaleidoscopes of loud heartbeats under coats.
sentences.chinese: 外套下隱藏的是萬花筒般的心跳。

sentences.english: For ethnics who want to add their culture to the mosaic that is America.
sentences.chinese: 爲想把自己的文化添入美國萬花筒的少數族裔說話。

definition: see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
Bohemia, historical country of central Europe
